pages.text: A tatami is a type of mat used as a flooring material.
Tatami were originally a luxury item for the nobility. The lower classes had mat-covered earthen floors.
Tatamis are made in standard sizes, twice as long as wide.
In martial arts, tatami are the floor used for training in a dojo and for competition.
There are rules concerning the number of tatami mats and the layout of the tatami mats in a room. "auspicious" which form a "T" shape and "inauspicious" form a "+" shape.
